channel.title: Hmm doesn't make sence?

item.title: Hmm doesn't make sence?
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:1, topic:145511”]Ok in my Attack method i added…

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == XXXX)
{
AAAA = 2;
BBBB = true;
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 60, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
}

Of course the XXXX means the item ID, i dont wanna put it for obvious reasons…
AAAA - kinda like pkingdelay, but different…
BBBB - just another thing stating whether its true or false :X…
Compiled, no errors…
Then underneath that i added…

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == XXXX)
{
PkingDelay = 3;
UseBow = true;
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
}

Again, XXXX = Weapon ID…

So, that has the same createProjectile… as the weapon above it…
Now, i get these errors…

client.java:13526: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable offsetX
location: class client
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn
+ 1);
                             ^
client.java:13526: cannot find symbol
symbol  : variable offsetY
location: class client
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 40, 31, AttackingOn
+ 1);
                                      ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

Now what i dont understand is, why, when i compile without that second weapon, it works perfect, no errors (NOTE: The first weapon has same project) and when i compile with the second, i get those errors…

Anyone?

Apreciated, thx[/quote]

Really, please read this before posting again - KThx

Read full topic
